cs213.photoAlbum.model

Interface Backend

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileStorageBackend

    public interface Backend
    A Backend Interface is responsible for reading and writing the state of the program on disc.
    Author:
    Nadiia Chepurko

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteUser(java.lang.String ID)
      This method deletes the user with the specified id.
      java.util.List<User> getUsers()
      This method returns existing users as a list of user objects.
      User readUser(java.lang.String ID)
      Read a user (including all constituent user data, see User Specification above) identified by user ID from storage into memory.
      void writeUser(User user)
      This method is used to write a specified user object to storage including all user fields.

    • Method Detail

      • readUser

        User readUser(java.lang.String ID)
        Read a user (including all constituent user data, see User Specification above) identified by user ID from storage into memory.
        Parameters:
        ID - The user ID.
        Returns:
        User object or null if does not exist.

      • writeUser

        void writeUser(User user)
        This method is used to write a specified user object to storage including all user fields.
        Parameters:
        user - The user object to save to storage.

      • deleteUser

        void deleteUser(java.lang.String ID)
        This method deletes the user with the specified id.
        Parameters:
        ID - The id of the user to be deleted.

      • getUsers

        java.util.List<User> getUsers()
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method returns existing users as a list of user objects.
        Returns:
        List of users as a list of type user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Gets thrown when there is an error opening the files.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Gets thrown when the object stored on disc is of unknown type.
